net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource

Class CachedResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.CachedResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CachedFactoryResource

    public class CachedResource
extends java.lang.Object
implements Resource

    A CachedResource object is used as a view to a real Resource implementation that has been cached. No checks are made against the caching policy for the underlying resource. Using this class implies the underlying resource is cachable.

    Disk cache storage is as follows:
    name = miwtcache-id-locale
    hash = SHA hash of name
    file = SHA[0-1] / SHA[1-]
    short
    short - state of the file. 0x0DED is invalid, 0x1000 indicates a consistent file
    long
    integer - starting position of the meta data
    bytes
    resource content
    byte
    content type, 0 = binary, 1= character stored using the specified encoding
    UTF string
    resource ID
    UTF string
    character set, empty for binary data
    UTF string
    content type
    long
    expire time
    UTF string
    identity tag, empty string if identity tag is null
    long
    last modified time
    long
    length of the content (for character data the length using the specified encoding)
    short
    number of properties
    UTF string / UTF string
    key / value pairs for each property
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • getAuthorizationState

        public Resource.AuthorizationState getAuthorizationState()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Get the authorization state of a resource for the requesting user. Return Resource.AuthorizationState.authorized if the resource doesn't require authorization.

        This method can be called outside of isolation. If that mode isn't supported by the Resource then return Resource.AuthorizationState.requires_isolation.

        Specified by:
        getAuthorizationState in interface Resource
        Returns:
        the state.

      • getCachePolicy

        public CachePolicy getCachePolicy()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Get the caching policy for this resource. A cacheable resource can have the content persisted (in memory, on disk, etc.) and used without further calls to getInputStream() or writeContent(OutputStream). Normally if the resource is not cacheable, the getLastModified() method should return -1. Otherwise some external caching algorithm may be used that is outside of the control of the medium.

        It is highly recommended to implement the equals() and hashCode() method if returning a cacheable policy from this method. This will allow better caching of content.

        This will be called outside of isolation. If the cache policy changes due to the resource changing, make sure Resource.isContentCompatible(String) and Resource.getIdentityTag() are implemented to trigger isolation of the resource for caching user-agents or implement the logic for determining cache policy in this method instead of Resource.setIsolationLevel(IsolationLevel).

        Specified by:
        getCachePolicy in interface Resource
        Returns:
        A CachePolicy (see CachePolicy for common constants), must never be null.

      • getContentType

        public java.lang.String getContentType()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Get the content type, i.e. MIME type, of the resource. Should never return null.
        Specified by:
        getContentType in interface Resource
        Returns:
        A MIME type, i.e. "image/png".

      • getDataAccessMethod

        Returns:

      • getExpireTime

        public long getExpireTime()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Get the expire time in milliseconds since the epoch. You can use this property to control the frequency in which the resource is checked to see if it has been modified. This method may be called outside of isolation.
        Specified by:
        getExpireTime in interface Resource
        Returns:
        the expire time in milliseconds. Return 0 if the resource expires immediately.

      • getIdentityTag

        public java.lang.String getIdentityTag()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Get the identity tag for the resource. This method will be called only when the isolation level is Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_COMMITTED. The return value must adhere to the specified for HTTP identity tags, a.k.a. "ETag". If a returned value does not it may be ignored. The value should be Resource.IDENTITY_TAG_MAXIMUM_LENGTH characters or less and contain any characters expect those from the set [0-31, 127, "]. This may be more restrictive than the specification.
        Specified by:
        getIdentityTag in interface Resource
        Returns:
        String or null if identities are not supported.

      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Get a property from this resource. These properties are for information purposes only. The implementation should return null for properties it does not know. The implementation may return null for all properties as well. There are constants defined for well known properties.

        This method may be called while not isolated in addition to being called while isolated. If calls outside of isolation are not supported by the resource, then the resource should return null.

        Specified by:
        getProperty in interface Resource
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the property.
        Returns:
        The value of the property or null.

      • moveToDisk

        boolean moveToDisk()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Move the memory cache to the disk cache. If the data is already in the disk cache no action is taken.
        Returns:
        true if moved to disk, false if read committed and cannot move to disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs in which case the memory cache is not removed.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no memory cache.

      • release

        void release(boolean ignoreLock)
        Release any memory resources. This method does not invalidate the disk cache.
        Parameters:
        ignoreLock - true to invalidate even if locked, normally should be false.

      • requiresIsolation

        public boolean requiresIsolation()
        Description copied from interface: Resource

        Specified by:
        requiresIsolation in interface Resource
        Returns:

        See Also:
        Resource.setIsolationLevel(IsolationLevel)

      • setIsolationLevel

        public void setIsolationLevel(Resource.IsolationLevel level)
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Set the isolation level for this resource object. This method is used when serving out the resource in order to provide consistency between the data and metadata of the resource. Depending on the implementation, when the level is Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_COMMITTED the resource may need to keep the metadata in memory until the level is set back to Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_UNCOMMITTED. An implementation can expect a Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_UNCOMMITTED to follow a Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_COMMITTED. Nesting of the Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_COMMITTED and Resource.IsolationLevel.READ_UNCOMMITTED should not occur. Callers must use ResourceManagerImpl.setIsolationLevel(Resource, Resource.IsolationLevel) to set the isolation level.
        Specified by:
        setIsolationLevel in interface Resource
        Parameters:
        level - the level to set, null is not allowed.

      • supportsRandomAccess

        public boolean supportsRandomAccess()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Test if the resource supports random access. This should always return the same value for a class. It can be called outside of isolation. If true, the InputStream returned from Resource.getInputStream() should support an efficient implementation of InputStream.skip(long) for Resource.DataAccessMethod.getInputStream_BINARY. If true, the Resource.writeContent(OutputStream, Range) method may be called with a Range that the Resource implementation must honor for Resource.DataAccessMethod.writeContent_BINARY.
        Specified by:
        supportsRandomAccess in interface Resource
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • touch

        protected void touch()
        Update the access time.

      • writeContent

        public void writeContent(java.io.OutputStream os,
                         Range range)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Write the content to the given OutputStream. The OutputStream should not be closed by this method.
        Specified by:
        writeContent in interface Resource
        Parameters:
        os - The OutputStream to write to the Resource data to.
        range - optional range. May be null. This will only be specified if the resource supports random access (Resource.supportsRandomAccess()). Implementations should get the starting position by calling Range.getStart(long) and the ending position by calling Range.getEnd(long). This implies that the resource length must be known.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the operation is not supported.
